org.drip.xva.strategy

Class NettingGroupPathAA2014

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drip.xva.netting.ExposureGroupPath
      • org.drip.xva.netting.CreditDebtGroupPath
        • org.drip.xva.strategy.NettingGroupPathAA2014

  • public class NettingGroupPathAA2014
extends CreditDebtGroupPath
    NettingGroupPathAA2014 rolls up the Path Realizations of the Sequence in a Single Path Projection Run over Multiple Collateral Groups onto a Single Netting Group in accordance with the Albanese Andersen (2014) Strategy. The References are: - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2014): PDE Representations of Derivatives with Bilateral Counter-party Risk and Funding Costs, Journal of Credit Risk, 7 (3) 1-19. - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2014): In the Balance, Risk, 24 (11) 72-75. - Gregory, J. (2009): Being Two-faced over Counter-party Credit Risk, Risk 20 (2) 86-90. - Li, B., and Y. Tang (2007): Quantitative Analysis, Derivatives Modeling, and Trading Strategies in the Presence of Counter-party Credit Risk for the Fixed Income Market, World Scientific Publishing, Singapore. - Piterbarg, V. (2010): Funding Beyond Discounting: Collateral Agreements and Derivatives Pricing, Risk 21 (2) 97-102.
    Author:
    Lakshmi Krishnamurthy
